# Cleaning PCR Mats {#sec-general-PCRmats}

## Introduction

-   **Purpose**: This procedure describes how to clean and decontaminate PCR mats for reuse.
-   **Procedure Type**: General Lab Maintenance
-   **Author**: N. Earp
-   **Date Created**: 2024

## Materials

-   Used PCR mats
-   Container or tray for soaking
-   Nitrile gloves
-   Lab coat
-   Safety glasses

## Solutions

-   5% bleach solution (diluted from stock bleach)
-   Tap water
-   DI water (deionized water)

## Safety Precautions

::: {.callout-warning title="Warning - Chemical Hazard"}
**Bleach Safety**:
- Wear nitrile gloves, lab coat, and safety glasses when working with bleach solutions
- Work in a well-ventilated area
- Never mix bleach with acids or ammonia-containing products
- Rinse skin immediately if contact occurs

See @sec-general-lab_safety for complete laboratory safety guidelines.
:::

## Procedure

1.  Put on appropriate PPE (gloves, lab coat, safety glasses).

2.  Place used PCR mats in a container or tray.

3.  Cover PCR mats completely with 5% bleach solution.

    ::: {.callout-note title="Note"}
    Ensure all surfaces of the mats are submerged in the bleach solution for effective decontamination.
    :::

4.  Let sit in 5% bleach solution for 15 minutes to decontaminate.

5.  Rinse PCR mats thoroughly with tap water to remove bleach residue.

6.  Rinse PCR mats with DI water for a final rinse.

7.  Lay PCR mats flat on clean paper towels or a drying rack to air dry completely.

8.  Once dry, store cleaned PCR mats in a clean, designated location.

## Waste Disposal

-   Dispose of bleach solution down the sink with running water
-   Discard disposable gloves in regular trash
-   For hazardous waste disposal guidelines, see @sec-general-hazard_waste
